title: ViacomCBS Seeks To Raise $3 Billion
text:
Shares of the media company surged 40% since the launch of the streaming platform earlier this month and gained 169% since the beginning of the year. Its shares closed at $100.34 on Monday but fell 4.3% in after-hours trading following news of the offerings.

The company plans to raise $2 billion from an offering of its Class B common shares and another $1 billion from a mandatory convertible preferred stock offering. Underwriters will be given an optional 30 days to buy up to an additional $300 million in Class B stock and up to an additional $150 million in convertible preferred stock, ViacomCBS said.

Paramount+ replaced the company's CBS All Access service and will effectively serve as a home base for one of Hollywood's largest studios, featuring an extensive library along with new shows, live news, sports and movies from the Paramount and Miramax studios.

The media giant faces challenges as it introduces a consumer brand in a competitive and expensive streaming video market. The streaming wars led to a rush in new movie and television series productions, with billions of dollars spent by Netflix Inc., Amazon.com Inc. and Walt Disney Co.'s Disney+.

ViacomCBS said in February that it had 30 million paying subscribers to its video-streaming services.
